cscd211Methods

Class Lab1Methods

  • java.lang.Object
    • cscd211Methods.Lab1Methods

  • public class Lab1Methods
extends java.lang.Object
    Lab1Methods contains helpful methods needed for testing your program.
    The contents of the file are:
    # of Sandwiches in the file guaranteed to be > 0
    The name of the sandwich
    The calories in the sandwich
    The number of toppings on the sandwich - guaranteed to be > 0
    one topping per line
    ...

    You are guaranteed a well formed file

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Lab1Methods()
      You WILL NOT WRITE this constructor it is provided by Java.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Sandwich[] fillArray(java.util.Scanner fin)
      The fillArray method:
      First - reads the number of Sandwiches in the file - you are guaranteed the value will be greater than 0
      Second - makes an array of type Sandwich for the length
      Third - reads a single Sandwich information from the file and builds a Sandwich object
      Fourth - places that Sandwich object into the array
      NOTE: You will want to ensure your input buffer is empty after reading in numbers I recommend Integer.parseInt(fin.nextLine());
      static int menu(java.util.Scanner kb)
      The menu method guarantees that a menu choice between 1 and 5 inclusive is entered.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • fillArray

        public static Sandwich[] fillArray(java.util.Scanner fin)
        The fillArray method:
        First - reads the number of Sandwiches in the file - you are guaranteed the value will be greater than 0
        Second - makes an array of type Sandwich for the length
        Third - reads a single Sandwich information from the file and builds a Sandwich object
        Fourth - places that Sandwich object into the array
        NOTE: You will want to ensure your input buffer is empty after reading in numbers I recommend Integer.parseInt(fin.nextLine());
        Parameters:
        fin - representing the Scanner object to the file
        Returns:
        an filled array of Sandwich objects
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the Scanner fin is null

      • menu

        public static int menu(java.util.Scanner kb)
        The menu method guarantees that a menu choice between 1 and 5 inclusive is entered. Furthermore, it ensures the input buffer is empty at the end of the method. The menu choices are:
        1) Print the array to the screen (System.out) by calling the printArray method in the ArrayUtils class
        2) Sort the array based on the natural order by calling the selectionSort method in ArrayUtils class
        3) Sort the array by imposing a total order by calling the compare method in the SandwichCaloriesComparator class
        4) Print the array to a file that is specified by the user after prompting for a filename. This printArray method that resides in the ArrayUtils class uses a PrintStream object to print to the file. The PrintStream object is closed after printing.
        5) Quit the program

        Parameters:
        kb - representing the Scanner object to the keyboard
        Returns:
        the menu choice guaranteed by you the programmer to be between 1 and 5 inclusive
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the Scanner fin is null
